title: Killer Blonde
features: Every serial killer has a type. But what if that type is part of a larger, more dangerous agenda?With virtually identical women being murdered in Minnesota, panic is causing huge politicalpressure to get the killer off the streets. Celebrated investigator Cade Dawkins is given the hotpotato case and hopes to get it wrapped up before the governor has his head. But the killer hashis own agenda—one that goes beyond simply murdering knockout blondes. As it becomes acat and mouse game between killer and investigator, Dawkins begins to realize he just may bethe mouse.
description: "Reminiscent of James Patterson and Thomas Harris." -Laura Smith, author of Saving Hascal's Horrors and The Stable House"Loved every minute of this crime mystery!" - Erica Lorraine, BookBub review"Killer Blonde is an edgy thriller that will keep you invested and desperately trying to solve the mystery. Allan Evans is a new author to me and it has been years since I have read a book like this, or enjoyed it so much."  -MagicMarc93, BookBub review"Pulled me in and didn't let me go until the final page." - Laura Furuta, Amazon review"The author does a fantastic job of gripping you from the first page and you can't put it down until the end." -Partygirl1985, BookBub review"The action is well-paced and builds suspense with intensity, keeping the reader gripped in the investigation and apprehension of the killer. The climax of the story is terrific, with a nice twist." - GTB, Amazon review"A definite thrilling read, with a scary serial killer and a very likable hero." - Mary van Ede, Amazon review"A fast paced novel that will keep you on your toes." - Ttreadway1, BookBub review"A thrilling read with plenty of twists." - Heidi Schoolman, BookBub review"This novel has it all: murder, mystery, hidden agendas, plots, politics, rivalry, a lot at stake, dramatic developments, danger, tension, and even a little romance." - Munchkin8911, BookBub review

Twin Cities' author Allan Evans has been finding writing success of late. His debut novel, ABNORMALLY ABBEY published in September. A short story, SILENT NIGHT, is in the Haunted Yuletide anthology published in December and a serial killer thriller set in the Twin Cities, KILLER BLONDE, was published in early 2021. All are from Immortal Works Press.
